intro: Ulex minor, commonly known as the lesser bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant produces tiny, dark blue or black berries that are often used in traditional herbal medicine. Ulex minor thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its delicate appearance and historical uses make it a notable species in botanical studies.
